fields.name: Shelley Mitchell's TALKING WITH ANGELS
fields.htmlLong:
Shelley Mitchell's TALKING WITH ANGELS, one of San Francisco's most critically acclaimed theatrical events, is an epic true story about four young artists' search for guidance and survival during the Nazi occupation of Hungary in 1944.

The diaries of these artists' give an account of their dialogue with invisible forces that appeared to them at the time as angels. In 1960 these diaries were smuggled into France by the only survivor of the group, Gitta Mallasz. It was first published in France in 1976 where it became an immediate best seller. It has sold over 800,000 copies in French and been translated into 14 languages.

Shelley has performed TALKING WITH ANGELS throughout the United States and in Europe at the Dublin Theatre Festival and the Dutch Theater Festival. In 2000 TALKING WITH ANGELS tapped into San Francisco's heart and won Best of the Fringe Theater festival.

Read more reviews at http://www.talkingwithangels.com/html/press.html

http://www.shelleymitchell.org

fields.headline: $15 tickets ($35 value) to Shelley Mitchell's Talking with Angels. We donate 50% to Women's Initiative.
fields.htmlLong:
Deal Overview

Shelley Mitchell's TALKING WITH ANGELS, one of San Francisco's most critically acclaimed theatrical events, is an epic true story about four young artists' search for guidance and survival during the Nazi occupation of Hungary in 1944.

The diaries of these artists' give an account of their dialogue with invisible forces that appeared to them at the time as angels. In 1960 these diaries were smuggled into France by the only survivor of the group, Gitta Mallasz. It was first published in France in 1976 where it became an immediately best seller. It has sold over 800,000 copies in French and been translated into 14 languages.

Shelley has performed TALKING WITH ANGELS throughout the United States and in Europe at the Dublin Theatre Festival and the Dutch Theater Festival. In 2000 TALKING WITH ANGELS tapped into San Francisco's heart and won Best of the Fringe Theater festival.

Read more reviews here: http://www.talkingwithangels.com/html/press.html

http://www.shelleymitchell.org/

Fine Print

Expires 04/09/2012. You will be asked to specify a performance on the next page. Tickets are available for the following performances:

  • Thursday, March 31st
  • Friday, April 1st
  • Saturday, April 2nd
  • Thursday, April 7th
  • Friday, April 8th
  • Saturday, April 9th

To redeem your purchase, you will need to print out your ticket and bring it to the performance.

The Venue

The Royce Gallery is a quaint, intimate theater in the heart of the Mission. It's located at 2901 Mariposa at Harrison Street.

Reviews

Cute small intimate venue. No frills. Personally, I feel that the lack of special effects forces the actors & directors to work harder at the classic... - Sue Y. (Yelp)

I saw David Mamet's Oleanna here and was really impressed. This little theater put on a much better production than A.C.T. did with Mamet's November, which... - Sara W. (Yelp)

A spiritual-political project [much like] Kushner envisioned for his masterpiece Angels in America, Shelley Mitchells performance is passionately mystical yet remarkably lucid. She brings these characters to life with consummate craft. - SF Bay Guardian

Shelley's work is very definite, very sound, very detailed - Lee Strasberg
